extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.jolt.JoltTransformJSON
extension.description: Applies a list of Jolt specifications to either the FlowFile JSON content or a specified FlowFile JSON attribute. If the JSON transform fails, the original FlowFile is routed to the 'failure' relationship.

property.name: Jolt Transform
property.description: Specifies the Jolt Transformation that should be used with the provided specification.

allowableValue.description: Shift input JSON/data to create the output JSON.
Execute list of Jolt transformations.
Apply default values to the output JSON.
Remove values from input data to create the output JSON.
Change the cardinality of input elements to create the output JSON.
Sort input json key values alphabetically. Any specification set is ignored.
Custom Transformation. Requires Custom Transformation Class Name
Writes when key is missing or value is null
Always overwrite value
Writes when key is missing

property.name: Jolt Specification
property.description: Jolt Specification for transformation of JSON data. The value for this property may be the text of a Jolt specification or the path to a file containing a Jolt specification. 'Jolt Specification' must be set, or the value is ignored if the Jolt Sort Transformation is selected.

property.name: Custom Transformation Class Name
property.description: Fully Qualified Class Name for Custom Transformation

property.name: Custom Module Directory
property.description: Comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories which contain modules containing custom transformations (that are not included on NiFi's classpath).

property.name: Transform Cache Size
property.description: Compiling a Jolt Transform can be fairly expensive. Ideally, this will be done only once. However, if the Expression Language is used in the transform, we may need a new Transform for each FlowFile. This value controls how many of those Transforms we cache in memory in order to avoid having to compile the Transform each time.

property.name: JSON Source
property.description: Specifies whether the Jolt transformation is applied to FlowFile JSON content or to specified FlowFile JSON attribute.

allowableValue.description: Transformation applied to FlowFile content containing JSON
Transformation applied to FlowFile attribute containing JSON

property.name: JSON Source Attribute
property.description: The FlowFile attribute containing JSON to be transformed.

property.name: Pretty Print
property.description: Apply pretty print formatting to the output of the Jolt transform

property.name: Max String Length
property.description: The maximum allowed length of a string value when parsing the JSON document

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If the JSON transformation fails (e.g., due to invalid JSON in the content or attribute), the original FlowFile is routed to this relationship.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: The FlowFile with successfully transformed content or updated attribute will be routed to this relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.jolt.JoltTransformRecord
extension.description: Applies a JOLT specification to each record in the FlowFile payload. A new FlowFile is created with transformed content and is routed to the 'success' relationship. If the transform fails, the original FlowFile is routed to the 'failure' relationship.

property.name: Jolt Transform
property.description: Specifies the Jolt Transformation that should be used with the provided specification.

allowableValue.description: Shift input JSON/data to create the output JSON.
Execute list of Jolt transformations.
Apply default values to the output JSON.
Remove values from input data to create the output JSON.
Change the cardinality of input elements to create the output JSON.
Sort input json key values alphabetically. Any specification set is ignored.
Custom Transformation. Requires Custom Transformation Class Name
Writes when key is missing or value is null
Always overwrite value
Writes when key is missing

property.name: Jolt Specification
property.description: Jolt Specification for transformation of JSON data. The value for this property may be the text of a Jolt specification or the path to a file containing a Jolt specification. 'Jolt Specification' must be set, or the value is ignored if the Jolt Sort Transformation is selected.

property.name: Custom Transformation Class Name
property.description: Fully Qualified Class Name for Custom Transformation

property.name: Custom Module Directory
property.description: Comma-separated list of paths to files and/or directories which contain modules containing custom transformations (that are not included on NiFi's classpath).

property.name: Transform Cache Size
property.description: Compiling a Jolt Transform can be fairly expensive. Ideally, this will be done only once. However, if the Expression Language is used in the transform, we may need a new Transform for each FlowFile. This value controls how many of those Transforms we cache in memory in order to avoid having to compile the Transform each time.

property.name: jolt-record-record-reader
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for parsing incoming data and determining the data's schema.

property.name: jolt-record-record-writer
property.description: Specifies the Controller Service to use for writing out the records

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: If a FlowFile fails processing for any reason (for example, the FlowFile records cannot be parsed), it will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: The original FlowFile that was transformed. If the FlowFile fails processing, nothing will be sent to this relationship

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: The FlowFile with transformed content will be routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: record.count
writesAttribute.description: The number of records in an outgoing FlowFile

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME Type that the configured Record Writer indicates is appropriate
